description: Easy - Phoenician Heritage and Carthage's Foundation

questions.question: What Mediterranean people were renowned as merchants, traders, and seafarers throughout the ancient world?
options: The Greeks, who established land-based empires through military conquest and colonization
The Phoenicians, who built commercial empires through trade networks and merchant activity
The Romans, who focused on military expansion and territorial dominion in Italy
The Carthaginians, who controlled all Mediterranean trade routes exclusively

questions.question: What major achievement did the Phoenicians contribute to writing systems and alphabets?
options: They developed hieroglyphic writing systems similar to Egyptian hieroglyphs
They created complex cuneiform symbols used throughout the ancient Mediterranean world
They developed one of the first alphabetic writing systems using simple sound symbols
They invented the first numerical system for calculating trade transactions

questions.question: How did Phoenician cities establish their influence throughout the Mediterranean region?
options: Through military conquest of territories and establishment of administrative provinces
By establishing trading posts and colonies for commercial purposes rather than conquest
By creating a unified Mediterranean empire under a single ruler's authority
Through forced assimilation of local populations and cultural suppression

questions.question: According to ancient sources, when was Carthage traditionally founded?
options: Around 1000 BCE by Greek colonists fleeing the Peloponnesian War
Around 500 BCE by Roman merchants establishing trading posts in North Africa
Around 300 BCE by Alexander the Great's successors after his death
Around 814 BCE by Phoenician settlers from the city of Tyre

questions.question: What famous story describes how Carthage's founder negotiated land from local Berber peoples?
options: The story describes the founder cutting an ox-hide into strips to cover more land than expected
The story claims the founder married a local Berber princess and received land as a dowry
The story details how the founder defeated local armies in battle to claim territorial lands
The story recounts the founder's payment of gold and silver for coastal territorial possession

questions.question: Which Phoenician city was the traditional source of settlers who founded Carthage?
options: Sidon, the greatest Phoenician city and center of Mediterranean trade networks
Byblos, which had previously controlled much of the Levantine coastal territories
Tyre, the most powerful Phoenician city from which colonists departed
Aradus, which maintained control of distant Phoenician colonial outposts

questions.question: What advantages did Carthage's geographic location provide to the growing settlement?
options: A harbor positioned to control Mediterranean trade routes and maritime commerce effectively
Proximity to Egyptian grain supplies and Mediterranean shipbuilding resources centrally
Strategic location for defending against Roman military expansion from Italian territories
Access to tin trade routes from western Europe and Atlantic coastal regions

questions.question: Why did western Phoenician colonies like Carthage become increasingly important during the 6th-5th centuries BCE?
options: Greek city-states began expanding westward and forced Phoenicians to migrate further west
The Phoenician homeland was conquered by Persian and later other eastern powers
Roman armies from Italy began attacking Phoenician colonies in North Africa
Egypt's naval dominance forced Phoenician merchants to establish alternative trade routes

questions.question: What territories did Carthage control or colonize by the 3rd century BCE?
options: Only the North African coast and nearby Mediterranean islands without broader expansion
Spain (Iberia), Sicily, Sardinia, Corsica, parts of Morocco, and coastal North African regions
The entire Mediterranean including Egypt, Greece, and coastal Roman territories completely
Only isolated trading posts without direct territorial control or colonial administration

questions.question: Why were Phoenician ships considered among the most advanced vessels in the ancient world?
options: They were equipped with multiple rows of oars and sails combined for maximum speed
They were sturdy, seaworthy vessels capable of long-distance Mediterranean and ocean voyages
They featured iron reinforcement and advanced navigation instruments for precise route finding
They were designed specifically for military warfare rather than commercial trading purposes
